A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I think this is the best Star Wars film I've watched. The action sequences are not a mess of explosions ala Michael Bay. In fact\, the big battles are far and few in-between what is mostly a character-driven story. There's still too much exposition to be desired\, but it can be forgiven with the genuine desire to tell a story.\nAction\, comedy\, and excitement fans\, beware. This film may come across as boring to you. There are long stretches of the film that is nothing but just talking and going from point A to point B. If you love Fast and Furious or Transformer-type films\, you might be disappointed with this one. The best sequence for me was the opening. It's just pure cinema gold.
